greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by upwards antidiagonals: T(m,n) = number of set partitions into distinct parts of the multiset consisting of one copy each of x_1, x_2, ..., x_m, and two copies each of y_1, y_2, ..., y_n, for m >= 0, n >= 0.
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, Vol. 4A, Table A-1, page 778. (Background information.)
link: D. E. Knuth, Partitioning a multiset into submultisets, Email to N. J. A. Sloane, Dec 29 2018.
formula: Knuth gives a recurrence using the Bell numbers A000110 (see Maple program).
maple: Q := proc(m,n) local k; global B; option remember;
(1/2)*( Q(m+2,n-1) + Q(m+1,n-1) - add( binomial(n-1,k)*Q(m,k), k=0..n-1) ); fi; end;  # Q(m,n) (which is Knuth's notation) is T(m,n)
mathematica: Table[Q[m-n, n], {m, 0, 8}, {n, 0, m}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 02 2019, from Maple *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 30 2018
